topic.title: Technical help for running ZeroNet on a remote server
topic.body: I am running ZeroNet on a remove server and do port forwarding to my local PC. Unfortunately when closing the ssh to the remote server ZeroNet dies. What can I do to have it continuously running?

topic.title: Authorization on ZeroNet gets lost every now and then
topic.body: While being connected via Tor it looks like the personal identity gets lost at some unclear stage and I have to logout and "Login to another account" again. I do have the Multiuser plugin working - at least I think it is working - any idea to improve that ?

topic.title: I like to support ZeroNet
topic.body:
I have some spare server capacity and like the idea of ZeroNet. As I am not a coder how can I best support the Net in different ways? 

Your proposals and hints are highly welcome - the more detailed the better or dont be scared about my follow up questions :-)

topic.title: How anonymous am I while using ZeroNet with TOR?
topic.body:
was a question here: https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/90s4mv/how_anonymous_am_i_while_using_zeronet_with_tor/ 

Maybe one can bring discussion a bit into ZeroNet and add value to ZEROTALK by asking here :

"whatever54654: If you used Zeronet without TOR then you should delete your user data/folder before you connect with TOR. "  
Are this files "poisoned" - wky, in which way please?

topic.title: Maximum number of relays under one external IP
topic.body:
Is there like on TOR a maximum number of instances that I can run under one external IP only?

If so - what makes the limitation?

1528382232_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body: When I use the tracker list from below, I do get 7/30 or even 12/30...how many percent do I need to get a green tracker notice and update is working

1535486435_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fs.body:
Yes, I do launch it from terminal from the locl PC with "python2 zeronet.py --ui_ip "*" --ui_password"

What I would like is that I start it from local PC and hopefully runs for ever or checks itself and restarts after it might crash, even when I shutdown my local PC
@nofish: Thank you - so i would install "screen" local start it and shutdown my local PC?

I am not sure what you mean by child process so let me just explain what I do and happens:

I log into the remote server via ssh and port forwarding the 43110 to a local port on my PC
then: ZeroNet-master$ python2 zeronet.py --ui_ip "*" --ui_password any-password
it starts and runs correctly until i send my local PC to hibernation or shut it down.
This obviously stops the SSH process right at that time with terminal still open.
So if I start back the local PC from hibernation i still can see the time it stopped in my last open terminal session -its the time when the hibernation started

Solved - thank you all who helped.

As screen was already installed on my PC - i wasn't aware of that - i am doing it with screen - the only change i did is:

3. python2 zeronet.py --ui_ip "*" --ui_password any-paasword

Maybe one question left:

If ZeroNet crashes under those remote circumstances and i am obviously not aware - how can i best bring it to auto-start again (under Linux and FreeBSD) - maybe with sending me a short notice afterwards? 

I like to install it on several servers and cant check all the time - maybe there is a special MUNIN template here available as well?

1536332522_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fs.body: Ok - how to do that most efficiently - I am  a newbie as some call it (and maybe your explanations help others who might read it)

Lets start with seeding sites, as it seems easiest  - not own sides
Does this mean that I have to be on each side first and klick on every single link on it or is there a better way to do it - a way of harvesting content?

@robione - whats the advantage for people to come in ZN via a Proxy?

Whats the legal side on offering a Proxy-service for the provider?

> [robione](#comment_17_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): make a public ZN proxyadd it to http://zero.acelewis.com/he also has videos on youtube that explain how

those proxy seem not work at the time, because of taioan.tk in the background (maybe down) - but I will check the videos - thanks

> [gardenparty](#comment_9_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fsgXz3F): @robione - whats the advantage for people to come in ZN via a Proxy? [...]

ok :-), one answer to myself: https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/997p2i/zeronet_open_proxy/

> [kaffie](#comment_649_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Just visit the site's homepage and that will seed it. If there are optional files you can start seeding them by enabling the option in the sidebar (click+drag the 0 button in the top right corner).

Thats done kaffie - thank you

On that right side -what are Database (reload, recreate) are doing
and
what is SiteControl (actualize/pause) for ?

1536424390_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fs.body:
"I'm volunteering my minimal, surface-level knowledge in case it's useful at all." - i like your kind of understatement and help, even if i dont understand every word you say :-)

Why is an IP attached to a file I hold?

> [caryoscelus](#comment_82_13oRBYqNeUr6Tvgt4KkAT9FT4XRiKFBjnE): As i said, i don't know much details. But there should be a way to check whether site is hosted by peer in order to make transmissions. Perhaps someone more competent can add more details.

Yes, could we please have a detailed explanation of that process?

1537118724_14RCTJp4ozmDH2c49CxmC98Mfp1fs.body: Thanks @ z9eradct .Maybe my question was not clear enough:  How many ZeroNet instances can I run under one single IP and does it make sense at  all to run more than one?
